remarks: Define a function ` J ` that provides a bijection from nonzero vectors ` V ` to nonzero functionals with closed kernels ` C ` .  (Contributed by NM, 22-Feb-2015.)
statement:
lcf1o.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lcf1o.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcf1o.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcf1o.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
lcf1o.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` U ) $.
lcf1o.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` U ) $.
lcf1o.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lcf1o.r $e |- R = ( Base ` S ) $.
lcf1o.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
lcf1o.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lcf1o.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lcf1o.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lcf1o.q $e |- Q = ( 0g ` D ) $.
lcf1o.c $e |- C = { f e. F | ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) ) = ( L ` f ) } $.
lcf1o.j $e |- J = ( x e. ( V \ { .0. } ) |-> ( v e. V |-> ( iota_ k e. R E. w e. ( ._|_ ` { x } ) v = ( w .+ ( k .x. x ) ) ) ) ) $.
lcflo.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lcf1o $p |- ( ph -> J : ( V \ { .0. } ) -1-1-onto-> ( C \ { Q } ) ) $.
$d .+ f k v w x $.
$d .0. x $.
$d ._|_ f k v w x $.
$d .x. f k v w x $.
$d F f $.
$d L f $.
$d R f k v x $.
$d V f v x $.
$d k v w x $.
